Function Documentation

void SCI_ClearFlag ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_Flag 
)

Clears the flag status of specified SCI flag.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_Flag,:specify the flag to be cleared. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SCI_FLAG_PAR : SCI parity error flag
  • SCI_FLAG_TXC : SCI transmitted character flag
  • SCI_FLAG_WT : SCI waiting timer flag
Return values:
None

Definition at line 392 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

void SCI_ClockModeConfig ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_CLKMode 
)

Determines the SCI output clock signal is driven by hardware or software.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_CLKMode,:specify the SCI clock pin mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SCI_CLK_SOFTWARE : SCI output clock is controlled by software
  • SCI_CLK_HARDWARE : SCI output clock is controlled by hardware
Return values:
None

Definition at line 65 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

void SCI_ETUConfig ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_ETU,
u32  SCI_Compensation 
)

This function is used to configure the Elementary Time Unit.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_ETU,:specify the SCI Elementary Time Unit.
SCI_Compensation,:Enable or Disable the Compensation mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SCI_COMPENSATION_ENABLE : Compensation mode enabled
  • SCI_COMPENSATION_DISABLE : Compensation mode disabled
Return values:
None

Definition at line 166 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

FlagStatus SCI_GetFlagStatus ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_Flag 
)

Get the status of specified SCI flag.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_Flag,:specify the flag that is to be check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SCI_FLAG_PAR : SCI parity error flag
  • SCI_FLAG_RXC : SCI received character flag
  • SCI_FLAG_TXC : SCI transmitted character flag
  • SCI_FLAG_WT : SCI waiting timer flag
  • SCI_FLAG_CARD : SCI card insert/remove flag
  • SCI_FLAG_TXBE : SCI transmit buffer empty flag
Return values:
SETor RESET

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_InitStruct,:pointer to a SCI_InitTypeDef structure.
Return values:

Definition at line 87 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

void SCI_IntConfig ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_Int,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the specified SCI interrupt.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_Int,:specify the SCI interrupt source to be enabled or disable. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • SCI_INT_PAR : SCI parity error interrupt
  • SCI_INT_RXC : SCI received character interrupt
  • SCI_INT_TXC : SCI transmitted character interrupt
  • SCI_INT_WT : SCI waiting timer interrupt
  • SCI_INT_CARD : SCI card insert/remove interrupt
  • SCI_INT_TXBE : SCI transmit buffer empty interrupt
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 331 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

void SCI_OutputDIO ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_DIO 
)

Output the SCI DIO pin low or high by software.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_DIO,:specify if the SCI DIO pin to be high or low. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SCI_DIO_HIGH : Drive SCI DIO signal high
  • SCI_DIO_LOW : Drive SCI DIO signal low
Return values:
None

Definition at line 302 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

void SCI_PDMACmd ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_PDMAREQ,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or disables the SCI PDMA interface.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_PDMAREQ,:specify the SCI PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • SCI_PDMAREQ_TX : Tx PDMA transfer request
  • SCI_PDMAREQ_RX : Rx PDMA transfer request
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 195 of file ht32f5xxxx_sci.c.

void SCI_SoftwareClockCmd ( HT_SCI_TypeDef *  SCIx,
u32  SCI_CLK 
)

Output the SCI clock pin low or high by software.

Parameters:
SCIx,:where SCIx is the selected SCI from the SCI peripherals.
SCI_CLK,:specify if the SCI clock pin to be high or low. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SCI_CLK_HIGH : Software drive SCI output clock high
  • SCI_CLK_LOW : Software drive SCI output clock low
Return values:
None
